data.1-connect-button#1. Connect Button: This serves as the entry button to connect a wallet. When clicked, it opens either the Welcome Modal if no wallet is detected or the Select Modal if any wallet is detected. After wallet connection, the button displays the connected account address truncated for the UI (i.e., B62qo7...F5dJSu). Clicking the connected button will present the Dropdown Menu for further options.
data.2-welcome-modal#2. Welcome Modal: Displayed when no wallet is detected, the Welcome Modal presents a redirect button to the Mina Protocol official guide page for installing wallets and a configurable list of links to the websites of popular Mina wallets.
data.3-select-modal#3. Select Modal: This is shown when at least one wallet is detected as installed. It displays a button list of wallets supported by the zkApp. Detected wallets are sorted to the top of the list for easy access. Click any of the wallets in the list to trigger a connection flow.
data.4-context-menu#4. Context Menu: Available after a wallet is connected, this dropdown contains menu options to copy the connected wallet address to the clipboard, connect to another wallet, and disconnect.

data.svelte#Svelte: Follow the steps below to seamlessly integrate the Wallet Adapter into your zkApp with just a few lines of code. Refer to the example starter project for the complete reference source code.
data.usage-steps#Usage steps:
Install dependency. Only a single package is required. npm install mina-wallet-adapter-ui-svelte pnpm add mina-wallet-adapter-ui-svelte yarn add mina-wallet-adapter-ui-svelte bun add mina-wallet-adapter-ui-svelte Import wallet components and store. Import the CSS file for the default theme. Feel free to customize the CSS styles or replace it with a project-specific stylesheet. import { WalletProvider, WalletMultiButton, walletStore } from "mina-wallet-adapter-ui-svelte"; import "mina-wallet-adapter-ui-svelte/dist/wallet-adapter.css"; // Default style. Feel free to customize for project-specific look. Utilize the components as HTML elements within the page document. Pass the list of wallet adapters to display as a parameter to the WalletProvider component. The WalletMultiButton component will show the "Connect Wallet" button and handle the entire connection workflow.
Get the wallet connection state and invoke connected wallet methods through the walletStore.
{#if $walletStore.connected}

Connected. Wallet address is {$walletStore.publicKey}.

{:else}

You are not connected. Click "Connect Wallet" button to connect.

data: This is a set of modular components and hooks for zkApps to easily interact with all major wallets in Mina Protocol ecosystem. It offers reusable interfaces for zkApps and wallets to integrate together.The Mina Wallet Adapter is written in TypeScript and allows adding wallets support into zkApps with a few lines of code.
